rationale: The segment contains intensifiers/comparatives ('unprecedented', 'largest ever') but they modify nouns ('spike', 'outbreak'), not risk-adjectives.
statement_text: Officials at the Department of Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Defra) ordered an estimated 35 million egg-laying hens indoors after an unprecedented spike in case numbers led to the 'largest ever' outbreak of H5N1, also known as bird flu, on UK soil.

rationale: The phrases 'unprecedented spike' and 'largest ever' outbreak are intensifiers/superlatives framing the situation alarmingly.
statement_text: Officials at the Department of Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Defra) ordered an estimated 35 million egg-laying hens indoors after an unprecedented spike in case numbers led to the 'largest ever' outbreak of H5N1, also known as bird flu, on UK soil.
